#Text=Sylvia Miles
#Text=Sylvia Miles ( née Lee ; [ 1 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=September 9 , 1924 – June 12 , 2019 ) was an American actress .
#Text=She was twice nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her performances in Midnight Cowboy ( 1969 ) and Farewell , My Lovely ( 1975 ) .
#Text=Miles was a fixture in New York City society , having lived there her entire life .
#Text=She performed in many Off-broadway shows , including starring in a one-woman musical based on her life , titled It 's Me , Sylvia !
#Text=A documentary about her life titled I Was Always Sylvia aired on New York City public television channel WNET as part of The 51st State series . [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=Early life
#Text=Miles was born and raised in Greenwich Village , New York City , where her father worked as a furniture maker . [ 6 ] [ 7 ]
#Text=According to an I-94 entry card from a 1962 flight that Miles took from London to New York , she was born on September 9 , 1924 . [ 8 ]
#Text=Miles stated her parents ' names were " Reuben and Belle " . [ 9 ]
#Text=She was educated at Washington Irving High School [ 1 ] [ 2 ] and the Actors Studio . [ 10 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Miles began her career on stage in 1947 [ 11 ] and on television and film in 1954 . [ 12 ]
#Text=In the early 1960s , she played the role of Sally Rogers in the pilot episode of what would become The Dick Van Dyke Show , which was later taken by Rose Marie for the series . [ 13 ]

#Text=She appeared Off-Broadway in “ Ruthless ! ” The Musical ( 1992 ) at the Players Theatre , NYC , playing Sylvia St. Croix ( originally played by Joel Vig in drag ) ; she was one of the few females to play the role .
#Text=Miles was cast in the film Midnight Cowboy ( 1969 ) as an aging Park Avenue kept-woman , who invites Joe Buck ( Jon Voight ) up to her penthouse apartment for sex . [ 14 ] [ 10 ]
#Text=The role earned her an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress , although she appeared on-screen for about six minutes . [ 15 ] [ 10 ]
#Text=She received a second Oscar nomination for Best Supporting Actress for her slightly larger role ( eight minutes ) in Farewell , My Lovely ( 1975 ) . [ 13 ]
#Text=Miles during the filming of 92 in the Shade , November 1974
#Text=Miles had a cameo role in the Indian suspense film Shalimar ( 1978 ) . [ 16 ]
#Text=She appeared in Evil Under the Sun ( 1982 ) , the film version of Agatha Christie 's novel of the same name , portraying a Broadway producer , one of her more mainstream film roles . [ 17 ]
#Text=She played real-estate agent Dolores in the Oliver Stone film Wall Street ( 1987 ) , a role she reprised in Wall Street : Money Never Sleeps ( 2010 ) . [ 18 ]
#Text=Wayland Flowers and his puppet Madame first uttered the widely quoted line , " Sylvia Miles and Andy Warhol would attend the opening of an envelope " . [ 10 ]
#Text=In 1976 , People magazine repeated the joke without citing a source . [ 6 ] [ 19 ]
#Text=Miles starred in Warhol 's film Heat ( 1972 ) . [ 20 ]

#Text=She was also featured in mainstream films including 92 in the Shade , Critical Condition , The Great Scout & Cathouse Thursday , Crossing Delancey , and the 1989 comedy She-Devil , in which she played the mother of Meryl Streep 's character . [ 21 ] [ 22 ]
#Text=In a New York restaurant in 1973 , Miles publicly dumped a plate of food onto critic John Simon 's head for his negative comments about her in a film review . [ 23 ]

#Text=In her final years , Miles appeared in a few roles on television such as Sex and the City and One Life to Live , and in the films Go Go Tales and Wall Street : Money Never Sleeps . [ 22 ] [ 10 ] [ 14 ]
#Text=Personal life
#Text=In 1948 , Miles married William Miles , but the couple divorced two years later . [ 10 ]
#Text=From 1952 to 1958 , she was married to Gerald Price . [ 10 ]
#Text=From 1963 to 1970 , she was married to radio disc jockey Ted Brown . [ 10 ]
#Text=Brown cited Miles ' lack of desire to have children as the main cause for their divorce . [ 9 ]
#Text=Miles died on June 12 , 2019 while en route to a hospital in Manhattan at the age of 94 . [ 10 ]
#Text=She was in declining health in recent years and was in nursing home care in her final months . [ 14 ]
#Text=During her final years she was suffering from anemia and respiratory issues . [ 24 ] [ 7 ]
#Text=Filmography
#Text=Film
#Text=Television
#Text=Sources : [ 22 ] [ 10 ] [ 14 ]
